intro: Calycorectes schottianus, commonly known as the Schottian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
